cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the north-west Gulf, making Gulf-coast landfall tonight, then racing up the Mississippi Valley toward Indiana and the lower Great Lakes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (south-central Louisiana / Mississippi coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None – no tropical watches in effect
weather_observation.warning_coast: None – no tropical warnings in effect
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through coastal Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: JACKSON MS (closest listed point in wind-probability table to the storm track north of the Gulf)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions Saturday evening into early Sunday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible as the post-tropical low passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – inland port well away from ocean surge
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with pockets of higher totals; potential for localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible on the south/east side of the low as it crosses Indiana
